TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}

S.FORM: ti sa Kapurar ka sitsuayan laḍuq aravats a nimadju.
ti sa Kaporar ka sicoayan ladroq aravac a nimadjo.
S.TRANSL: Once upon a time Kapurar had a very long penis [lit. his was very long].

S.FORM: qau nu masiasik a vavayavayan, vaik a sema qapaz.
qao no masiasik a vavayavayan, vaik a sema qapaz.
S.TRANSL: When women were weeding the fields, he went to the edge of the field.

S.FORM: qau sa qiladj, sa saksaki a kulits.
qao sa qiladj, sa saksaki a kolic.
S.TRANSL: He sat down and exposed his penis,

S.FORM: qau sa pataluvtuvan tua inasikan a tsemel nua vavayavayan.
qao sa patalovtovan toa inasikan a cemel noa vavayavayan.
S.TRANSL: and it went through the grass the women had weeded out.

S.FORM: nu tjału inu a vavayavayan, tjału inu uta a kulits a lemailaing.
no tjaljo ino a vavayavayan, tjaljo ino ota a kolic a lemailaing.
S.TRANSL: Wherever the women went the penis followed,

S.FORM: qau sa tsektsektseki a kinaḍangan nua vavayavayan.
qao sa cekcekceki a kinadrangan noa vavayavayan.
S.TRANSL: and touched the women’s private parts.

S.FORM: qau qarawqaw a vavayavayan a mavilad tua rekutjan tazua kulits ni sa Kapurar.
qao qarawqaw a vavayavayan a mavilad toa rekotjan tazoa kolic ni sa Kaporar.
S.TRANSL: The women screamed and ran away for fear of Kapurar’s penis.

S.FORM: łakua tavaken anga a tsuatsuay anga; ini anga ka rekutji.
ljakoa tavaken anga a coacoay anga; ini anga ka rekotji.
S.TRANSL: But after a time they got used to it and weren’t frightened any more.

S.FORM: qau nu masiasik a vavayavayan, sa tsektseki a kinaḍangan, tsektsekan uta azua kulits ni sa Kapurar tua vuka.
qao no masiasik a vavayavayan, sa cekceki a kinadrangan, cekcekan ota azoa kolic ni sa Kaporar toa voka.
S.TRANSL: When the women were weeding and their private parts were touched, they hit back at Kapurar’s penis with their digging-sticks.

S.FORM: łakua ini kełang azua vavayavayan tu kasi inu a mangtjez.
ljakoa ini keljang azoa vavayavayan to kasi ino a mangtjez.
S.TRANSL: But the women didn’t know where it came from.

S.FORM: nu tsektsekan tua vuka, maulaw.
no cekcekan toa voka, maolaw.
S.TRANSL: When they hit it with their digging-sticks, it disappeared.

S.FORM: tsuay anga uta mangtjez azua kulits.
coay anga ota mangtjez azoa kolic.
S.TRANSL: After a time it would come back again,

S.FORM: qau tsektsekan uta tua vuka.
qao cekcekan ota toa voka.
S.TRANSL: and get hit again with digging-sticks.

S.FORM: "tsevuk," aya azua kulits ni sa Kapurar.
"cevok," aya azoa kolic ni sa Kaporar.
S.TRANSL: “Tsevuk,” said Kapurar’s penis.

S.FORM: azua kulits ni sa Kapurar semamałi a kinalaḍuq.
azoa kolic ni sa Kaporar semamalji a kinaladroq.
S.TRANSL: Kapurar’s penis was an amazing length.

S.FORM: sinivałavałan azua kulits a palayulayu.
sinivaljavaljan azoa kolic a palayolayo.
S.TRANSL: He had it hanging(?) over his shoulder(?).

S.FORM: manu vaik tiamadju a qemałup.
mano vaik tiamadjo a qemaljop.
S.TRANSL: They went off to hunt.

S.FORM: qau kiłavaranan nua qaliqali: "tja qeneqenetjay a su kulits," ayain azua ti sa Kapurar nua qaliqali.
qao kiljavaranan noa qaliqali: "tja qeneqenetjay a so kolic," ayain azoa ti sa Kaporar noa qaliqali.
S.TRANSL: The others said: “Let’s have a look at your penis,” they said to Kapurar.

S.FORM: qau saksaken azua kulits, sa pakiqenetjan tua qaliqali.
qao saksaken azoa kolic, sa pakiqenetjan toa qaliqali.
S.TRANSL: He exposed his penis and showed it to them.

S.FORM: manu maka kiqenetj a qaliqali.
mano maka kiqenetj a qaliqali.
S.TRANSL: When they had finished looking at it,

S.FORM: "aitsu anga qała," ayain nua qaliqali a ventsa.
"aico anga qalja," ayain noa qaliqali a venca.
S.TRANSL: the others lied and said: “The enemy have come.”

S.FORM: ini kiamaw anga a venałavałan tua kulits ti sa Kapurar.
ini kiamaw anga a venaljavaljan toa kolic ti sa Kaporar.
S.TRANSL: Kapurar didn’t have time to shoulder his penis;

S.FORM: mintuluq timadju.
mintoloq timadjo.
S.TRANSL: he just ran.

S.FORM: qau rakatsen anga a kulits maka tjua djuidjuiin.
qao rakacen anga a kolic maka tjoa djoidjoiin.
S.TRANSL: His penis was dragged through thorny bushes.

S.FORM: qau djemałun ti sa Kapurar i tjumaq.
qao djemaljon ti sa Kaporar i tjomaq.
S.TRANSL: When he got home,

S.FORM: qau qemaqivu tua qaliqali, sa pasudjuian a kulits.
qao qemaqivo toa qaliqali, sa pasodjoian a kolic.
S.TRANSL: he called some people and got them to remove the thorns from his penis.

S.FORM: qau azua djui pitjua djilungen, sa padjungi.
qao azoa djoi pitjoa djilongen, sa padjongi.
S.TRANSL: The thorns were put in pots and stored away.

S.FORM: qau tsuatsuay anga, "kevava-u kevava-u," ayain a qaliqali.
qao coacoay anga, "kevava-o kevava-o," ayain a qaliqali.
S.TRANSL: After some time he said to the others: “Come and drink some beer, drink some beer.”

S.FORM: qau mangtjez a qaliqali.
qao mangtjez a qaliqali.
S.TRANSL: The others came,

S.FORM: pałetekuin azua djilung.
paljetekoin azoa djilong.
S.TRANSL: and he brought out the pots.

S.FORM: "aitsu a vava, kevava-u a matsidił," ayain a qaliqali.
"aico a vava, kevava-o a macidilj," ayain a qaliqali.
S.TRANSL: “Anyone can drink this beer as they want,” he said to the others.

S.FORM: qau azua vava tjanu sepatj i djilung.
qao azoa vava tjano sepatj i djilong.
S.TRANSL: There were four pots full of beer.

S.FORM: masalu a qaliqali.
masalo a qaliqali.
S.TRANSL: The others were pleased,

S.FORM: kiłuvaq a vaik a semutsaqev tazua djilung.
kiljovaq a vaik a semocaqev tazoa djilong.
S.TRANSL: and raced to go and take the lids off the pots.

S.FORM: manu sutsaqevan a djilung; milayap a pangats, sa tsałedji azua qaliqali a naventsa tjaimadju.
mano socaqevan a djilong; milayap a pangac, sa caljedji azoa qaliqali a navenca tjaimadjo.
S.TRANSL: When the lids were taken off the pots, out flew wasps and hornets and stung those who had lied to him.

S.FORM: qau mavilad azua qaliqali a mapułat.
qao mavilad azoa qaliqali a mapoljat.
S.TRANSL: And they all ran away.

S.FORM: qau a tjainan djui nua tjavuvuk a kinaqatian.
qao a tjainan djoi noa tjavovok a kinaqatian.
S.TRANSL: The bees were made from the thorns of wild strawberries,

S.FORM: qau a tjiḍiuł djui nua ładjudju.
qao a tjidriolj djoi noa ljadjodjo.
S.TRANSL: the large hornets from the thorns of paliurus,

S.FORM: qau a tsalukuł djui nua kadjuian.
qao a calokolj djoi noa kadjoian.
S.TRANSL: the small hornets(?) from the thorns of the thorn tree,

S.FORM: qau a łałuvur djui a paqeteleng a kinaqatian.
qao a ljaljovor djoi a paqeteleng a kinaqatian.
S.TRANSL: and the wasps(?) from various thorns.

S.FORM: qau avan sika uzai nua pangats tutsu.
qao avan sika ozai noa pangac toco.
S.TRANSL: And that’s why there are wasps and hornets now.
